definition: lit. to hang upside down/fig. in dire straits
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
lit. to rescue the people from hanging upside down (idiom, from Mencius); to save the people from dire straits
lit. the crisis of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation/dire straits
lit. the crisis of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation/dire straits
lit. the pain of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation/dire straits

sentences.english: She flew over him, coming to a stop upside down in midair, out of sight below.
sentences.chinese: 她从他头顶飞过，在视野之外的半空中倒悬着停住了。

sentences.english: Like cotton fiber spreading on bluish green sea .
sentences.chinese: 像撕薄了的棉絮，铺在倒悬著的碧海上。

sentences.english: Darkened and overhung by the running vine of the verses.
sentences.chinese: 晦暗，覆盖着倒悬的诗句的藤蔓。

definition: lit. ten thousand fathoms/fig. extremely high or deep/lofty/bottomless
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
